subject: UN/WB/FNG COMPENSATION COMMISS
body:
UN/WB/FNG COMPENSATION COMMISSION
OUR REF: UN-FGA/WB4/13
YOUR REF: (UN/WB/FGA)..00/14
BATCH: 70-35-671-39/188/18
Attention Dear beneficiary We have your Fund worth $950.000.00 dollar
in our office as it could be delivered or transfer to your home
address or through bank transaction before two young men by name
WILLIAM HUGES and JOHN CAMEL came with a sad news of your death they
also claim to be your relatives As they make inquiry to claim your
Fund as it is their rightful inheritance they told us that you gave
them the permissions at the hospital bed to claim your money before
you die we couldn't hand over your fund to them until we find out that
you not dead and if they are truly your sons please reconfirm with
your information if you are still alive and if not, they want to pay
the fee of $50 to claim your fund of $950.000.00 dollar so if you are
still alive please try get back to us with the payment of $50 as we
said by steam wallet or iTunes gift card and also tell us how you want
your fund to be transfer or to be deliver
Your Full Name
Your Country
Your Home Address
Your Direct Phone
Note.that the only money to pay for this transaction or delivery is
the registration fee of $50 and you purchase an iTunes card or steam
wallet of $50,and send the information to us for immediate remittance
of your fund to you.Note: that every claims has an expiring period of
five working days (5 days) so you have to do that very urgently Thanks
Your sincerely
Mr.Ego Igbo
Email; 
mregoigbo12@citromail.hu

subject: Re: UN/WB/FNG COMPENSATION COMMISS
body:
Hello,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I must say, this is quite a surprise! I had no idea about this fund. It's also surprising to hear about William Huges and John Camel claiming to be my relatives. I don't recall having any relatives by those names.

I'm curious, how did these two gentlemen prove their relationship to me? And could you please provide more details about the fund? How did it come into existence and why was it assigned to me?

Also, I'm not familiar with steam wallet or gift cards as a method of payment. Could you explain how that works?

Looking forward to your response.

Best wishes,
George
